data.description:
The late-2024 XRP breakout is back in focus, with market watchers suggesting the move could still be pointing to a much larger upside target. For context, XRP's price surge 647% from $0. 49 in late 2024 to above $3. 60 by mid 2025. Visit Website

data.title: Bitcoin threatens new breakdown as US PPI sends gold to 1-month high
data.description:
Hotter US PPI inflation data boosted precious metals but punished Bitcoin bulls, with BTC price downside nearing 3% on the day.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | U.S. Ambassador Warns Czech Republic on NATO Defense Spending
data.description: The U.S. ambassador to Prague has cautioned Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis about the country's potential shortfall in meeting its defense spending obligations to NATO. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting concerns over the Czech Republic's commitment to the alliance's financial requirements. The warning comes amid broader discussions on defense spending among NATO member states, emphasizing the importance of adhering to agreed-upon financial contributions. The Czech Republic's defense budget has been under scrutiny as it strives to align with NATO's expectations, which require member countries to allocate a certain percentage of their GDP to defense. This issue is part of ongoing dialogues within NATO, as member nations assess their financial commitments and strategic priorities.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | IAEA Reports on Iran's Uranium Enrichment Levels
data.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has reported that as of June 13, Iran's stockpile of uranium enriched to a 20% concentration in UF6 form remains estimated at 184.1 kilograms. According to Jin10, this update comes amid ongoing international scrutiny over Iran's nuclear activities. The IAEA's findings are crucial as they provide insight into Iran's nuclear capabilities and potential implications for geopolitical stability. The report highlights the importance of monitoring nuclear developments in the region, given the sensitive nature of uranium enrichment and its potential impact on global security.

data.title: March 1st Trading Day Historically Bullish for Markets
data.description: Jeffrey Hirsch, CEO of Hirsch Holdings and publisher of the Almanac Trader, posted on X that March 1st has historically been a bullish trading day. Over the past 76 years, the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) has increased 51 times on this day. The recent 25-year track record also shows strong performance. The S&P 500 has risen 64.0% of the time, while the NASDAQ has averaged a 0.47% increase.

data.title: AI's Impact on Work Hours and Leisure Time
data.description: In 1930, economist John Maynard Keynes predicted that by 2030, people would only need to work 15 hours a week to satisfy their material needs. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the role of artificial intelligence in potentially realizing this vision. The discussion centers around how AI advancements could lead to increased leisure time and the implications for society. As technology continues to evolve, the question arises: how will individuals utilize their newfound spare time?

data.title: Asian Stocks Maintain Appeal Amid Market Shifts
data.description: This week, discussions have centered around the perceived unfairness of the graduate tax and the stock market's transition from a YOLO (You Only Live Once) to a HALO (High Asset, Low Opportunity) mindset. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the continued attractiveness of Asian stocks in this evolving market landscape. The focus remains on understanding these shifts and their implications for investors.

data.title: The U.S. Fraud Sweeper Center in the District of Columbia has seized $580 million in cryptocurrency.
data.description: U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro, District of Columbia Attorney for the District of Columbia, announced that the Fraud Center's anti-fraud team has frozen and seized over $580 million in cryptocurrency from Southeast Asian criminal networks. Established in November 2025, the team is coordinated by the U.S. Department of Justice, the FBI, the Secret Service, and the Treasury Department, primarily targeting transnational criminal networks operating "pig butchering" scams in Myanmar, Cambodia, and Laos. Pirro stated that her office will pursue legal action to recover the funds and return them to victims as much as possible. Deddy Lavid, CEO of blockchain analytics platform Cyvers, told Decrypt that while the $580 million seizure is significant, it represents only a small fraction of global cryptocurrency fraud activity. Cyvers has identified approximately 27,000 active criminal groups with a total fraud exposure of about $27.5 billion. Pirro linked Southeast Asian fraud networks to organized crime in China, while Lavid pointed out that these networks are becoming increasingly decentralized, involving multinational operators and cross-border money laundering hubs.

data.title: Barclays is evaluating building a blockchain platform to process payments and deposits.
data.description: Barclays has sent out requests for information to several potential technology vendors to assess how to build a blockchain platform for banking services such as payments. Applications may include stablecoins and tokenized deposits, with the goal of finalizing vendor selection as early as April. The use of stablecoins in payments is expanding, with Bloomberg Intelligence estimating that annual stablecoin payment transactions could exceed $50 trillion by 2030. Meta has previously tested integrating stablecoin payments into its applications. Several banks have already begun deploying blockchain systems; JPMorgan has launched its deposit token, JPM Coin, for institutional clients for payments, and HSBC plans to expand its tokenized deposit service to corporate clients in the US and UAE in the first half of this year.

data.title: Expert: OpenAI Founder Altman Discusses Revenue Growth and Agreements
data.description: OpenAI founder Sam Altman recently commented on the importance of sustained revenue growth in relation to agreements. According to Jin10, Altman emphasized that as long as revenue continues to increase, agreements will not pose significant issues. This perspective highlights the critical role of financial performance in navigating contractual and operational challenges within the tech industry. Altman's insights reflect a broader sentiment among industry leaders who prioritize economic stability and growth as key factors in successful business operations.

data.title: IMF Chief Predicts U.S. Unemployment Rate to Remain Around 4%
data.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) anticipates that the unemployment rate in the United States will stabilize at approximately 4%. According to Jin10, this forecast reflects the IMF's analysis of current economic conditions and labor market trends. The organization suggests that the U.S. economy is likely to maintain this level of unemployment, indicating a relatively stable job market. The IMF's outlook is based on various economic indicators and assessments of potential risks and opportunities within the global economic landscape. This prediction aligns with broader expectations for the U.S. economy, which has shown resilience amid various challenges.

data.title: Pentagon Considers Further Discussions with Anthropic PBC on AI Technology Restrictions
data.description: The Pentagon is considering additional discussions with Anthropic PBC as a deadline approaches to ease restrictions on the use of its artificial intelligence technology. Bloomberg posted on X, citing a senior Defense Department official who confirmed the openness to further talks ahead of the 5 pm Friday deadline. The discussions aim to address concerns and potentially modify the limitations imposed on the AI technology's application. The Defense Department's willingness to engage in dialogue reflects the importance of balancing security measures with technological advancements.

data.title: Market Concerns Rise Amid Tight Credit Spreads and AI Price Movements
data.description:
The Long View, institutional investor, posted on X, highlighting concerns in the financial markets following the iConnections event. The discussion centered around the tightness of credit spreads, which are perceived as excessively narrow, potentially leading to a significant market event in the coming weeks or months. Additionally, there is skepticism regarding recent price movements in artificial intelligence stocks, suggesting that some valuations may be inflated.

The ease of underwriting in recent times has contributed to these tight credit spreads, raising alarms about the sustainability of current market conditions. Analysts are cautioning that the prolonged period of lenient underwriting standards could result in financial instability if corrective measures are not taken.

In a separate note, U.S. President Donald Trump was mentioned as being more astute than commonly acknowledged, indicating a nuanced understanding of his strategies and actions. This perspective adds a layer of complexity to the political landscape, influencing market sentiments and investor decisions.

data.title: U.S. Treasury to Directly Receive Revenue from Venezuelan Oil Sales
data.description: U.S. Energy Secretary Wright announced that revenue from Venezuelan oil sales will no longer be routed through Qatar but will be directly deposited into the U.S. Treasury accounts. According to Jin10, this change aims to streamline financial transactions and enhance transparency in the handling of funds from Venezuelan oil sales. The decision marks a significant shift in the financial management of these revenues, reflecting broader geopolitical and economic strategies. The move is expected to impact the dynamics of oil trade and financial flows between the involved nations.

data.title: Canadian Economy Experiences Decline in Fourth Quarter
data.description: The Canadian economy concluded the year with a downturn, marked by a significant reduction in business inventories that led to a 0.6% annualized decrease in real gross domestic product in the fourth quarter. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the impact of inventory reductions on economic performance. This decline reflects challenges faced by businesses in managing stock levels amid fluctuating demand and economic uncertainties. The contraction in GDP underscores the need for strategic adjustments to bolster economic growth moving forward.

data.title: Archer Aviation Partners with Starlink for In-Flight Internet
data.description: Archer Aviation has announced a collaboration with Elon Musk's Starlink to provide high-speed internet access to its air taxi passengers. Bloomberg posted on X that this partnership aims to enhance the passenger experience once Archer Aviation secures regulatory approval for commercial operations. The integration of Starlink's satellite internet service is expected to offer seamless connectivity during flights, marking a significant step forward in the air taxi industry.

data.title: STOCKS | Trump Media & Technology Group Sees Pre-Market Stock Increase
data.description: Trump Media & Technology Group's stock experienced a rise of approximately 1% in pre-market trading. According to Jin10, this increase comes amid heightened interest in the company's activities and potential developments. The stock movement reflects investor sentiment and market dynamics surrounding the group, which has been under scrutiny due to its association with U.S. President Donald Trump. Analysts are closely monitoring the situation to assess future trends and implications for the broader market.

data.title: OpenAI raised $110 billion, valuing the company at $730 billion.
data.description: OpenAI raised $110 billion, valuing the company at $730 billion pre-money. Investors included SoftBank ($30 billion), Nvidia ($30 billion), and Amazon ($50 billion). The company also established new strategic partnerships and acquired AI computing resources. ChatGPT currently boasts over 900 million weekly active users, over 50 million subscribers, and over 9 million paying enterprise users, and is expected to experience record growth early this year. This transaction brings the OpenAI Foundation's stake to over $180 billion.

data.title: OpenAI Secures $30 Billion Funding from SoftBank
data.description: OpenAI has successfully raised $30 billion in funding, with significant contributions from SoftBank. According to Jin10, this substantial investment underscores the growing interest and confidence in AI technologies and their potential impact on various industries. The funding is expected to accelerate OpenAI's research and development efforts, enabling the company to expand its capabilities and explore new applications for artificial intelligence. This move highlights the increasing collaboration between tech companies and financial institutions, aiming to drive innovation and technological advancement in the AI sector.
